description: Let's create a custom event and fire it when the strip breaks. This mechanism allows components to communicate with each other.
We'll handle the event in the slingshot component later. For now, let's fire a custom event!
We do this with the following line of code: "this.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('rubber-strip-broke', {composed: true}));". Add it to your _breakStrip function!
followUpMessage: Now the rubber strip breaks and fires an event. Note that you can give properties as well, but we'll cover that some other time. Now it is time for the slingshot to pick this up!

minifiedJavaScriptSolutions: class RubberStrip extends Polymer.Element{static get is(){return'rubber-strip'}static get properties(){return{side:{type:String,value:''},_isBroken:{type:Boolean,value:!1,observer:'_breakStrip'}}}ready(){super.ready();self.setInterval(this._stretch,7e3)}_breakStrip(){this.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('rubber-strip-broke',{composed:!0}))}_stretch(){!this._isBroken&&Math.random()>.8&&(this._isBroken=!0)}}window.customElements.define(RubberStrip.is,RubberStrip)

exercises.template:
<link rel="import" href="lib/polymer/polymer-element.html">
<link rel="import" href="leather-pouch.html">
<link rel="import" href="rubber-strip.html">
<link rel="import" href="handle.html">
<link rel="import" href="rock.html">

<dom-module id="slingshot">
    <template>
        <rock></rock>
        <leather-pouch></leather-pouch>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_leftSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_rightSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <handle></handle>
    </template>
</dom-module>

<script>
    class Slingshot extends Polymer.Element {

        static get is() {
            return 'slingshot';
        }

        static get properties() {
            return {
                _leftSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Left',
                },
                _rightSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Right',
                },
                _readyToFire: {
                    type: Boolean,
                    value: false,
                },
            };
        }

        ready() {
            super.ready();

            this._readyToFire = true;
            self.setInterval(this._fire, 6000);
        }

        _fire() {
            if(this._readyToFire) {
                console.log('Fire away!!');
            }
        }
    }

    window.customElements.define(Slingshot.is, Slingshot);
</script>

class Handle extends Polymer.Element{static get is(){return'handle'}static get properties(){return{size:{type:String,value:''}}}}window.customElements.define(Handle.is,Handle)
